DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( TMS ) use intermittent theta-burst stimulation ( iTBS ) paradigm affect sensorimotor dysfunction pain , spasticity , motor weakness sensory loss . TMS technique allow non-invasive stimulation cortex , modulate activity neuron . The purpose study assess feasibility use TMS iTBS paradigm treat sensorimotor dysfunction people incomplete spinal cord injury affect upper limb .
DOC.brief_title: Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation ( TMS ) Upper Limb Dysfunction Spinal Cord Injury : Feasibility Study
DOC.criteria: Aged 1870 year old inclusive Traumatic nontraumatic tetraplegic patient follow chronic incomplete ( AIS C D ) SCI injury ( sustain least three month ago ) Referred Sheffield Spinal Injuries Centre Be able provide write informed consent verbal consent presence independent witness Spasticity affect upper limb Modified Ashworth scale ( MAS ) 2 Stable medical treatment least 1 week 1 week TMS application Stable medical condition Aged le 18 year old Lack mental capacity consent Ventilated patient sedation Very acute ( < 3 month ) SCI patient Implanted electrical device pacemaker , Concomitant neurological condition , include history epilepsy Significant jointrelated limitation passive range movement Unable attend TMS session Pregnancy Inability tolerate TBS Significant upper limb contracture
